channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 21 states and DC join the FTC’s lawsuit against Uber
item.description: On Monday, nearly two dozen states, plus the District of Columbia, filed an amended complaint in the FTC's lawsuit against Uber. According to the lawsuit, Uber charged consumers for the Uber One subscription without their consent, billed them before the end of a free trial, and shared misleading claims about how much consumers can save […]

item.title: Trump Is Building a ‘U.S. Tech Force’ of 1,000+ Early Career Workers
item.description: The program will also hire experienced technologists directly from the private sector

item.title: The RAM crisis will be a disaster for gaming laptops — here’s why
item.description: Gaming laptops and pre-built systems are in trouble, as we may see more 8GB configurations as a result of RAM price hikes.

item.title: Here’s what the OpenAI and Disney AI deal means to you, and why you should be worried
item.description: Disney’s new partnership with OpenAI brings AI-generated content into the hands of fans, but raises serious questions about control, creativity, and the future of storytelling.

item.title: Trump’s Vile Post About Rob Reiner Has Some Republicans Breaking Ranks
item.description: President Trump blamed the acclaimed director for his own murder.

item.title: I hate that I love Riverside’s AI-driven “Rewind” for podcasters
item.description: Riverside's year-end review is amusing, but it represents a creative culture that's increasingly entwined with AI.

item.title: How Roomba invented the home robot — and lost the future
item.description: For many, iRobot's Roomba robot vacuum was their first experience with a home robot. When I got my Roomba in 2005, I felt like I was a step closer to my dream of living in a Jetsons-style home where a robot did my chores for me. It was expensive, around $300 for a small black […]

item.title: Crying over expensive RAM? Kioxia may have cracked the 3D RAM puzzle, paving the way for cheaper, faster memory — but it probably won't reach the market till the next decade
item.description: Kioxia develops eight-layer stackable oxide-semiconductor transistors for 3D DRAM - yet commercial deployment remains years away.

item.title: Ford is rebooting the F-150 Lightning as an EREV with a gas generator
item.description: Just last month, Ford seemed to be on the brink of sunsetting the F-150 Lightning. Today, the vehicle manufacturer announced plans to reboot the truck as a hybrid. This next generation of the F-150 Lightning will contain Extended Range Electric Vehicle. An EREV is similar in concept to a plug-in hybrid but with a larger battery that's topped up by a gas generator — the powertrain itself is all electric. This next generation of the F-150 Lightning will offer an estimated range of more than 700 miles. Production will end this year on the current F-150 Lightning models. This revamp of the F-150 L...

item.title: Valve Has the Secret to Playing Your Games Everywhere, and It’s Not Streaming
item.description: Sorry, Game Pass, but Steam may soon bring your games to every platform.

item.title: Hasbro’s New ‘Deadpool & Wolverine’ Figures Let Cassandra Nova Do That Horrifying Face Thing
item.description: Plus, Wesley Snipe's Blade gets the Marvel Legends action figure he's long deserved.

item.title: Disney’s OpenAI deal is exclusive for just one year — then it’s open season
item.description: After the one year is up, Disney is free to sign similar deals with other AI companies.

item.title: World's smallest AI supercomputer achieves world record with 120B-parameter LLM support on-device — what I don't understand, though, is how it does OTA hardware upgrades
item.description: Tiiny AI Pocket Lab is a pocket-sized Mini PC running large language models offline with optimized CPU and NPU performance.

item.title: Apple TV adds Google Cast streaming, but only on Android
item.description: Now it will be easier for Android users to watch Apple TV content on their TV with the addition of Google Cast support. However, even after this update, Google Cast is only an option on the Android version of Apple TV, not the iOS version. Likewise, the Android version still doesn't support AirPlay. The addition […]

item.title: Nvidia bulks up open source offerings with an acquisition and new open AI models
item.description: Nvidia acquired SchedMD, the lead developer of Slurm, and launched the Nemotron 3 family of open source AI models.

item.title: Ford takes $19.5 billion charge as it retreats from EVs
item.description: Instead, Ford said it will pivot hard into gas and hybrid models. Ford Motor said on Monday it will take a $19.5 billion writedown and is killing several electric-vehicle models, in the most dramatic example yet of the auto industry’s retreat from battery-powered models in response to the Trump administration’s policies and weakening EV demand.

item.title: I tested 15 cases for the Switch 2 and these are the best
item.description: You might find it kind of sad to put your hard-earned Switch 2 into a protective case. To me, it’s freeing. Sure, it can take away from the slick design. But using a case relieves me of the worry that the console will accumulate tons of little scratches, or worse. I’ve tested several types of […]

item.title: LG TVs Get Unremovable Microsoft Copilot App
item.description: Users are not thrilled.

item.title: 60 best gifts for men: Awesome, unique gift ideas for impossible-to-shop-for guys
item.description: Whether he likes camping, the latest tech, comfy athleisure, or Legos, we've got gift ideas for men he's sure to love.

item.title: Chinese Spacecraft Got Disturbingly Close to Smashing Into a Starlink Satellite
item.description: The close call underscores the need for improved coordination between satellite operators, Starlink’s vice president of engineering said.

item.title: Talk about a snappy attack - popular photo booth maker allegedly leaves user images at risk
item.description: Photos taken at booths get uploaded on the internet where they can easily be downloaded.

item.title: Forget the em dash — Redditors share 6 giveaways that something was written by AI
item.description: The em dash — a favorite of writers everywhere — has become one of the signature giveaways of AI writing. Reddit users are sharing other common tells.

item.title: ‘It made me a little bit kinder’: How managers use AI to make decisions
item.description: As AI becomes ubiquitous, companies are still figuring out how it will coexist with human judgment. AI is quickly moving beyond rote tasks and into the realm of bigger-picture decisions that once relied only on human judgment. As companies treat AI as a thinking partner, the technology also introduces new risks. But the efficiency gains are hard to ignore, and companies are going head first into adoption....
